They also had a great feature in the room, a printer with a nice long USB cord - I was thrilled since I could print out my boarding pass right in my room and head off to the airport - whoops, the ink on the print cartridge was running low - no luck. The thought behind the printer was great - execution left a bit to be desired. Nevertheless - a nice stay. I'd definitely give them another shot.

Reviews.Title: “Stay off the 7th floor if you do not smoke”
Reviews.Author: rhodepop
Reviews.Content: Our experience was not so hot. Stayed Sat-Thurs but my wife went to the hotel Spa on Friday so I confirmed, in person, our non-smoking room a day before checkout. When checking in on Saturday, I confirmed with the staff that our room was non-smoking. Around 1:30 am we were awakened by the smell of cigarette smoke and a VERY loud party down the hall. We called the front desk and they sent someone up. It happened again around 3. This time, I was told that our floor was a smoking floor and that we could move to another floor (at 3 am). I'm sorry but this is not the Red Roof Inn. The information given to me was wrong 3 times. Unacceptable. We moved floors the next day and the rest of the stay was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Visually divine, but...”
Reviews.Author: Writer/Director
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to staying at the St. Regis because we'd heard so much about the "legendary" service. Because of my job I don't often have time to do any research for restaurants to go to when travelling. I rely a lot of the time on the advice from the concierge where I'm staying. In the past I've never had an issue. But the concierge staff at the St. Regis needs a major overhaul. It was some of the worst service I've ever had. And that it was in a St. Regis is very surprising. The room was nice and clean. The rain shower was divine. The LCD screen by the bedside didn't always work. When selecting certain lights to go off, they wouldn't work - so we had to unplug lamps. Too bad the windows don't open and the AC blower isn't so strong. For the full story - keep reading. Otherwise, that's about it. FULL STORY: When we checked in, I asked the concierge for a restaurant where we could get Halibut. And maybe something with pasta. He sent us to a place called Rose Pistola in North Beach. When we got our menus we noticed there was no Halibut on it. That was irritating. We asked for a restaurant with Halibut and he sent us to a place WITHOUT it. Very strange. The only other item on the menu that looked decent was the Risotto. They were out of it. By that point it was nearly 9 PM - our choices were to eat there or go back and order over-priced room service. We asked our waitress if the chef would make us "Aglio e Olio" (an italian staple). He did, but it wasn't very good. In fact, we didn't see any garlic in it at all. The atmosphere in the restaurant was similar to an Applebees and the food wasn't much better. It was not authentic Italian. When we got back to the hotel I called to speak with the Concierge to inform him that he'd really let us down. He'd left for the day so I told the person who answered the phone. The man said the concierge would call us at 8:30 AM so I could tell him what kind of lousy dinner we had. No call from the concierge the next morning. The least he could've done was apologize. So I called him. That day (Monday) there was a new concierge working. I asked him to find us a place for lunch that served Caprese (that typical italian buffalo mozzarella and tomato salad). He gave us his favorite place, Scala's - and another one down the street. On our way to lunch we walked to a chocolatier given to us by Concierge Number 1 when we asked for a place to buy truffles. We said we wanted the best truffles - but NOT Joseph Schmidtt truffles. Well... We arrived at the address and noticed it was a candy store. They had chocolate items, yes, but none of them were truffles. Not a single one. We then walked all the way to the restaurant for lunch and noticed there was no Caprese on their menu. At this point it was like a running joke. Now Concierge Number 2 had failed. After running a Wild Goose Chase due to unaware and incompetant concierges we decided to just go back and look up Fodor's and Conde Nast online. Though Concierge Number 2 had booked us a place for dinner that evening, I didn't want to risk it. Doing the same thing over and over and expecting different results is insanity! It was our last night in the city and we were determined to find a good restaurant in San Francisco. Within 10 minutes online we'd found the best rated place in the city that was open on a Monday night (Jardiniere) and booked a table. Back in our room, Jeremy the Front Desk Manager sent his apologies and some wine and cheese. It was a very thoughtful note. Simply the mere mention was nice. Neither of the Concierges apologized. I got the feeling they don't like to admit fault. The trouble is = the database used by the concierge staff is not good. They need to compare that to Fodors and Zagats. Rose Pistola got 2 stars (out of five). That would've been nice to know. Had I known that, we'd have never gone there. Halibut or not. The other problem is they think about their personal tastes... Never once considering the tastes of their clients. They also need to ask better questions. Simply typing in the word "chocolate" into their database isn't going to bring up the best truffles in the city. Obviously it's my fault I relied on the concierges. But as a filmmaker, I don't often have time and in the past it's always been a great experience to rely on concierge wisdom. I shall think twice about returning to a St. Regis. For the price, one would think they'd have their act together by now.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: PSTravelingMan
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights at the St. Regis Hotel in San Francisco. We have nothing but good things to say about this hotel. Its a beautiful hotel, very modern, comfortable and quiet. The hotel staff is friendly and efficient. The beds are very comfortable, the rooms are large with great views of the city and very quiet. This is how a 5-star hotel should be.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, can use a few touch ups here and there.”
Reviews.Author: Mike_the_traveller
Reviews.Content: My three night stay at the St. Regis San Francisco property was excellent. But there are some areas that can need improvements. But first lets get to the positives. full disclosure: we got upgraded from deluxe corner room to metropolitian suite due to SPG Platinum status. Postives: the suites are very large with two flat screen tv and 1 small tv in the bathroom. the bathroom amentities are probably the best I've seen among the luxury hotel chains. everything in the room is controlled by electronic key pad (windows, lights, alarm, do not distrub sign, etc). The property is new so you will have updated modern decor and new furniture. The bathrooms are huge! Almost 1/3 the size of the room itself. Everything was clean and housekeeping came twice a day. it seems like they know when we're leaving and when we're in the room. Turndown service always included bottle water. There was not a morning when they forgot to bring my Wall Street Journal and my requested US Today (you'll be surprised how often hotels forget or don't care). Towels are soft and constantly refreshed and well stocked. Wireless internet in the room! The doorman, bellman, and parking attendants are very nice and knowledgable. This property is walking distance from the shops at Union Square and the SF Moma (but very far from Fisherman Wharf, the piers, Golden Gate Bridge). The decor is very modern, clean, and intricate. They definitely spent alot building and decoring the entire hotel. The pool is open 24 hrs (no lifeguard). The pool is very clean and nice. It is also ideal for swimming laps. The valet service was FAST and front desk always personally called for our morning "wake up call" (not a machine). Cons: No ice machine. Unfortunately you have to call to have ice delivered to the rooms. Sometimes its just easier to walk down the hall to get it youself. The shower did not have a curtain or door, so you end up splashing water everywhere. My wife complained that it took her forever to wash her hair b/c of the "rain showers". Since the showers did not have doors or curtains, the whole bathroom fogs up, preventing you from using the mirrors afterwards. Most upscale luxury hotels have doors where the toilets are, this one did not. May be inconvient when you're sharing the bathroom with someone else or would prefer more privacy. I like the open feel but not in this area! Internet still cost additional $15 when you are already paying $800+ per night (whereas internet at low end properties like Hilton Garden Inns are usually free).. a bit backwards. Overnight parking for guests is $51. This is the highest I've ever paid for overnight parking at a hotel. The butler service that comes complimentary wwith the room is a bit annoying. She went through the entire routine of showing us where every single thing is down to the light switch and how to plug in your ipod in the dvd player. Wasted about 15min of our time when we arrive in our room. The hotel needs to realize when guests arrive to their rooms, they just want to relax and not be bothered. Breakfast was insanely expensive ($5 for OJ and $16 for Pancakes... before tax, tip, and service charge). I'm sorry... but no plain pancakes are worth $16. The house car (Bentley) was always out or busy, so we did not get to use it at all despite asking every single day for 3 nights. One night we lucked out and it was available but the driver said they are restricted to a 2 mile radius around the hotel (so its pretty much useless in my opinion). Not sure if that was true or if he just didnt want to do his job. The rooms did not have and ironing board, iron, or coffee machine (maybe ppl that pay $800+ a night do not iron their own clothes or make their own coffee?). Tips: get a room a few floors above 8th floor. We can hear the cars at night below (sirens, police cars, car engines, etc). Walk down the block for Starbucks or Peets Coffee for morning fix. Overrall: You DO get what you pay for. The property is very luxurious and the service perfect. But since everything is so expensive, it really leaves no room for error. Perfection should be expected. I give it a five star because I think it deserves it, but it needs to fix my above mentioned pts before I come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraveler7
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. I stayed at the St. Regis recently for a business meeting. The entire stay was flawless. From check-in to check-out, the staff was helpful and gracious, and did everything they could to make my visit more pleasant. The room itself was comfortable, luxurious, and immaculate. The shower was one of those "rainwater" showers, and I hated to get out of it! There was also a wonderful soaking tub. The bed was comfortable, with plenty of pillows and indulgent bed linens. The TV in the bathroom area (as well as in the main bedroom) was a nice touch. As an example of the level of service, I asked for an iron, and they had it at my room in under ten minutes. The hotel has city maps available through the concierge, and they're excellent; they're the only map you'll need to find your way around the city. The St. Regis is in a terrific location, and is only a block from the Montgomery Street BART station-- very handy. We held our meeting onsite as well, and the conference facilities were far above average (as was the in-house catering). This will be a difficult standard to live up to for future meetings! I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: t_rose72
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at the St. Regis and it was just as grand this time as the last time! The rooms are luxurious, comfortable and I had a great view of the city! The service is wonderful from the minute you drive up to the minute you check out. The only feedback I would have is that for some reason it's hard to locate on the block. Both times I went there, I drove past it without even seeing it the first time. But maybe that's just me. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: mstolper
Reviews.Content: They really got this one right. Beautiful rooms, great location, perfect service. This gives the Four Seasons and the Mandarin Oriental in S.F something to aspire to.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels!”
Reviews.Author: PwCTrojan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is now one of my favorite places to stay! The rooms are stylish with alot of high tech features and the decor of the hotel is modern but not to the point where it feels sterile. Ame restaurant has amazing food and nice atmosphere. Remede spa was also a delight! I got the seaweed detox wrap and it was on of my favorite treatments ever. The spa is just the right size and does not get crowded, which is very important to me. You literally never have to leave this hotel or feel like you want to, that's how great it is. I will definitely return to this hotel when I'm looking for a nice weekend getaway .

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Consistent With These Latest Revies”
Reviews.Author: MangoChetney
Reviews.Content: Used 1000 starpoints to drop the price to $300 on 2/17. The overnight parking fee with tax for one night was $51. The superior room was wonderfully appointed with the outstanding bath area. One quirk - the in-room bar offers beer and wine so I called room service to deliver two mixed drinks. They said it is policy not to do so and to go to the bar for the drinks. No mention of the butler. I teased them and asked if bathrobes were allowed in the bar - we were on the 11th floor. So I went down and got the drinks and verified at the front desk that I had been advised correctly. The desk person pressed the elevator buttons for me....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Sleek Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: qaz123
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis is a modern, luxurious beauty. Located in the Soma district, near to many cultural attractions and a short walk from Union Square, this hotel really delivers. Fitted out with the latest in technology--Sony DVD/CD stereo systems, large 42 inch plasma televisions, and a bedside digital control panel (to control lights, climate, phone, etc.), the rooms were very attractively done in a sophisticated palette of light greys, white, and dark woods. The limestone bathroom was beautiful, with a quick-filling (and quick-draining) soaking tub large enough for two. The walk-in separate shower had a limestone bench and a rainfall spout on the ceiling. Though there was only one sink, the vanity was large and well-stocked. My girlfriend had a massage at the Remede spa. She said the facilities were very sleek--maybe too sleek--and that the service was impeccable. We had breakfast delivered to our room--it came RIGHT on time and was piping hot. The food was served on very attractive Vera Wang china. The service was extremely responsive and friendly. There is a beautiful infinity edge lap pool next to the spa, with many a comfortable place to sit. The gym is quite nicely outfitted and extremely clean. We made use of the complimentary car service--they seem to use a new Bentley--which was quite convenient and a nice touch. All in all, this was a truly comfortable hotel. With all the amenities, you might even call it an urban resort. Whether you are looking for a spot to enjoy a weekend getaway or for a convenient, luxurious business hotel, the St Regis delivers.

Reviews.Title: “Great New/Modern St Regis”
Reviews.Author: jmittle
Reviews.Content: The New/Modern St Regis is the best St Regis I have stayed at...sure the St Regis NYC is a classic but this hotel in SF really proves how they can adapt to modernity....ceilings are high...guest rooms are very high tech....I am starwood plat and was nicely upgraded to a suite....breakfast in room was great...location is great right near the W....Overall a great new hotel to SF!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary St Regis in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: PauloAmore
Reviews.Content: I booked the St Regis at short notice on an unexpected lay over in San Francisco direct with the hotel. Although not cheap, you get what you pay for.... I took a standard room and loved it. The bed had great linens, super soft pillows etc. The bathroom was integrated with the bedroom, like some Asian hotels (Langham Place Hong Kong). I.E There is a hatch between the deep bath and the bedroom. Keep it closed for privacy, keep it open to watch the massive Plasma hung on the wall. One of the reasons that I paticularly liked it was the tech in the room. The bedside clock doubled as a touchscreen for everything in the room. Loghts, blinds, wake up etc. All good. Bar good, great staff especially the helpful concierge team. Good location. Good shopping, arts, Market Street, walk to Fishermans Wharf Chinatown etc etc. FYI - Sit in the lobby and watch guest after guest stick their hand in the fire to check if it's real. It is.......

Reviews.Title: “St Regis "Light".”
Reviews.Author: piatty73
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for the first time to celebrate a birthday. I have to say that at first we were disappointed and said we would go back to the Four Seasons or the Ritz. Some of the reasons were we were told that like the St Regis NY there was butler service. We were at the St Regis NY and loved the service we received from our butler. In San Francisco there was no offer to press clothes and no morning or afternoon butler service for coffee or tea. When I asked about it at first we were told it was through room service only. Then we were offered a coffee maker with starbucks which we took. It seems that there are 8 butlers on staff in SF compared to 62 in NYC. I do not consider there to really be butler service here. I have read several reviews concerning noise at this hotel I agree that there is an issue with a fire station down the street and when they blast their sirens it is loud even on the 19th floor where we were. But this is city hotel and street noise in SF as in NYC is to be expected. What we loved was the corner floor to ceiling windows in the room we had. It only had one sink in the bathroom but the soaking tub, shower and flat screen were nice. The hotel car was a new Bentley and they took us to dinner each night. The concierge was friendly but gave some inaccurate info on time and distances. The breakfast was good but expensive. The excercise room was well equipped but the Remede spa would not give you a locker if you did not have a treatment. In conclusion I would look for the best rate with the Four Seasons being my first chice in SF but this was a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the St. Regis”
Reviews.Author: SharonLynne
Reviews.Content: I was in San Fran for a convention in mid-October and was lucky enough to stay at the St Regis for 4 nights. The hotel is a very short walk to Moscone Center, next door to the MOMA, and just steps from designer shops and many restaurants. An excellent location, and although guests can hear the sirens from the streets below, I'm not sure what any inner city hotel could do to avoid all such noises. I was lucky to get a corner room which had large windows fully across two walls. The room design and decor were beautiful and delivered a "zen like" aura....very calming. I used the large bath tub every day, but also loved the rain shower. I found the room commander screen complimented the hotel's contemporary design, easy to use and state of the art. Several reviews on this site have mentioned the screen was too bright, but they must not have seen the option to dim the panel which fully reduced the light for sleeping. The comfort of the bed was superior, both mattress and linens. My flat screen was positioned directly in front of the bed, and it was very easy to navigate the programming. I found the lobby to be quite intimate and loved the fire wall near the cocktail area. I enjoyed sitting on the sofas, sipping a glass of wine, warming by the fire and watching all of the activity in the lobby. I found the gym area to be one of the nicest I've visited in hotels.....chilled bottled water, iced towels, fresh fruit, full time attendant, etc. The in-door pool was lovely as well. I highly recommend the St. Regis, especially if you can get a convention rate.

Reviews.Title: “Chic!”
Reviews.Author: Cissy
Reviews.Content: Upon just returning from a whirlwind weekend in San Francisco with the St. Regis as my hotel, I will admit I was taken aback as to how wonderful this hotel is. First let me state that the noise that is mentioned in other reviews is correct, not quite sure why so many fire engines are out and about on a Saturday evening - but I was on the 18th floor and they were loud. But when I look at the amazing view - well they did stop at about 2am - so a trade off of sorts. On to my review. I arranged with the hotel to have a car and driver pick me up at the airport who was there waiting for me upon my arrival in the baggage claim area - sign in hand - and off we went. When we arrived at the hotel (which is about a 30 minute drive) I was quickly greeted and brought to the check-in desk, which was quick, professional with just the right amount of friendliness. My "butler" was off with another guest so I agreed to let myself in to my room and my "butler" would meet me there within a few minutes to show me how everything works. My room, the executive level premiere, was located on the 18th floor - corner room - just spectacular! Floor to ceiling windows, with a view of the city and mountains in the background - surreal - especially at night (as odd as this may sound to some, I would certainly tolerate the sound of the sirens for this view again). My room was large, beautifully decorated, and spotless. King size bed, beautiful delicious linens, huge bathroom with a large tub and separate large shower stall - stocked with lots of towels, large writing desk, huge flat panel television in the sleeping area (also a small flat panel in the bathroom perfectly placed so that if you were taking a bath the television could be viewed), cd player and a mini bar that was stocked to the extreme. When my "butler" arrived he then proceeded to show me how to operate the touch panel that controls various functions within the room - from lights to drapes and everything in between. He also asked if I had any pressing (complimentary) and what time I would like my bed turned down. Their lobby bar is chic and lovely, perfect for a relaxing drink. And their restaurant, Ame – was just grand with fabulous service, fantastic wine list and food that was truly amazing. The staff and service at this St. Regis goes beyond what anyone would expect and carries it all out with perfection. They pay attention to every little detail from remembering your name to your morning paper arriving bright and early (in the cutest little cloth newspaper bags hung on your door). Lets say that they do more than try – they succeed! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, wish I had more time...”
Reviews.Author: kht2006
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night (Saturday) in Sept 2006 as a mini-getaway without our toddler. We live in the SF Bay Area. We arrived a little before check-in time and was told our room was not ready. They offered to store our rollerboard, took our cell phone number and would call us when our room was ready. Check-in was fairly quick and easy. My parents were going to take my toddler home with them for the night. I took my daughter to the restroom in the lobby area to change her diaper. There was absolutely no place to do it. When I returned to the front desk to ask where I might be able to change her, I was told that our room was ready and that someone would take us up. I liked how your need to pass reception to access the elevators - always nice in busy city hotels. As others have described, a "butler" escorts you to your room and explains the room to you - in particular, how to use the computer touch pad by your bedside to control practically everything in the room. Mu husband had to remind the hotel about the champagne that he had pre-arranged. We expected it to be waiting for us when we arrived. However, it did appear that the hotel was ready for us b/c the champagne and chocolates showed up less than 2 minutes after my husband reminded them. The room is clean and spacious for a city hotel room. We were on the 18th floor facing the street (not the alley). I agree with the person who noted that the tv was not mounted in an ideal place on the wall for viewing from the bed. Also, it's an expensive high-definition tv but the hotel receives none of the HD TV stations in the area. Unfortunate waste of money. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom only has one sink, but that was not a big deal for one night. The bath amenities are generous - large bottles of shampoo, conditioner, bath gel and lotion from the hotel's Remede Spa. TV in the bathroom a nice touch. The movable wall between the spa tub and room opens the room up. The shower is large with both a "rain" shower head and your traditional shower heads. The decor is clean, modern with great stylish small touches. The closet is on the small side, but sufficient for the business traveler or people not staying long. The room had your usuals - slippers, bathrobe, umbrella, safe. Nice selection for the in-room bar and snacks. You also get your own fax. Breakfast was included for us. We ate in the restaurant. Not a large restaurant and we had to wait a few minutes for a table. We were directed to the coffee available at the restaurant entrance, but they were out of coffee so we stepped out onto the outdoor terrace for a looksy. When we returned a minute later, the coffee, table, cups, everything!, was gone. Odd. We went back out and someone came to get us a couple minutes later. The pool looked amazing - wish I had time to partake. The locker room was nice too - clean and had salon products. The lobby bar area looked cozy - did not have time to enjoy. The gym had a ample variety of equipment. As another reviewer recommended - there's plenty of Evian at the gym for you to take! Overall nice experience. People remembered our name and greeted us throughout our stay. Friendly staff. Our past hotel experiences include the Four Seasons, the Peninsula, the W Hotel, Hiltons, Marriotts, Hyatts. I would rank this St. Regis up with the Peninsula but not quite the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Remede spa”
Reviews.Author: ElleMac
Reviews.Content: be careful when signing the receipt at the St Regis spa Remede.... they slam an automatic 20% tip onto any fees... they don't suggest... they just add it....WHAM!! This option should be open on the receipt for the customer to add at will.... kind of a crass bit on their part at the end of the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Color Palette”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The color choices of this new luxury hotel are fabulous, as is their art collection. It is 1/2 block from the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art, and we chose a package that included free tickets. The hotel is also a 20 minute walk from the new attraction -- the Ferry Building -- with its many food shops and restaurants. My small complaints? When we arrived mid-morning and I asked where I could get a cappuccino I was directed outside to a nearby Starbucks. I expect a hotel of this caliber to have this available in their bar area. If they can make a Bloody Mary, they can make coffee. My other complaint is the lobby bar which "misses" somehow. This bar is a big vacuous room, lacking warmth and congeniality. The tables aren't convenient for your drinks, and beware sitting near the "fireplace" feature. It looks lovely, but the outside doors are directly behind it and the chill from them is not pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: snaggletooth
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 night stay at the St Regis San Francisco. We booked a standard room for a medical conference but I guess due to my starwood preferred guest status ( and availability ) we were booked into a junior suite. My only beef for the remainder of the stay was the service ( or lack of ) out front as our cab pulled up. Nobody anywhere near the place where you are dropped off. WE opened out own door and lugged our bags to the check in. From this point on, every single facet of our stay was wonderful. We were shown to our room by our butler, and given the demonstration on all of the features, which were really helpful since so many things were automated and controlled with the bedside controls. The best part was the living room, couch. Probably the most comfortable experience ever, to lounge on the couch in front of the plasma. Watching the first round of the NFL draft, eating steaming hot Blueberry pancakes ( from room service) and lounging on that couch was the best moment I spent in San Francisco Our suite was so nice we ate breakfast there every morning. The butler service was nice as well. Any request and somebody was right there. The best way I can describe the service at this hotel, was that I never ever saw anybody from a service persepcive, yet whenever we needed anything at all, it seemed like somebody was immediately there to take care of it. Great bed. Large shower with soaking tub. Great soft towels and bathrobes. There isn't much in terms of out-of-room dining, but the room service is well above average in terms of quality and selection. We didn't have much of a view from the room, but the view IN the room was nice enough

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel experience at teh St. Regis”
Reviews.Author: land3d
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week at the St. Regis San Francisco (my wife and two sons 17 and 20). I can honestly say that my stay was one of the best experiences I have encountered in years. The service was impeccable, rooms magnificent, and location is within walking distance of shopping, dining, Moscone Center, and sights. San Francisco is one of the great destinations of the world and as such has its share of world class hotels; The St. Regis ranks as one of the finest anywhere. The rooms are modern, sleek, high tech, and clean; some rooms having magnificent views of the bay and city. As mentioned in other reviews, you really don't want to leave. We were treated as would be expected in a 5 star hotel without stuffiness or insincere over the top attentiveness, while at the same time, being responsive and attentive to our needs when expected. They refer to you by name, and to me, though not essential, is always impressive. If you like old world decor, this is probably not the place for you. The decor is very modern, with a Zen quality; light, simple lines, fresh, natural, peaceful. The bathrooms are luxurious, and bedrooms, though not huge, are spacious and comfortable. The beds are comfortable and fabrics rich. The most impressive thing (though when you first arrive it seems austere and cold), the staff is warm and attentive, and the Hotel's attention to subtle details, creats an intimate hotel experience, much different than what you get from the large, impersonal business hotels. The hotel meets and exceeds expections, and although not inexpensive, you don't feel cheated, we felt that we paid for superior service, decor, and quality, and we received it. Overall a great experience, as I look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “great escape”
Reviews.Author: racb
Reviews.Content: While I live in San Francisco, I decided to spend the weekend at the hotel as an escape. It was a great experience-a quite luxurious oasis--with great service and a modern but not austere design. Would highly recommend for a stress reducing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wake and smell the onions”
Reviews.Author: MovieGuyParadise_CA
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, as you would expect for the price. Great & very helpful staff. Comfy rooms, nice linens. 42" Flat panel TVs are nice, but it seems odd to not have HDTV broadcasts (as major city where every network broadcasts in HD). The meeting/dining facilities were very elegant. But the one complaint I had was being awakened by the very strong smell of cooking onions from the restaurant on the 4th floor-I was on the 5th facing the alley. Made it difficult to go back to sleep. This was not a case of a window being open, but it was being sucked into the ventilation system. Fairly quiet in terms of interior noise and street sounds. In room DVD/CD player, fax and printer are all nice touches. Great overhead shower. Bathroom only had a single sink, and no full length mirror, so it was difficult for 2 people to get ready at the same time. Conveniently located to shopping, movies and museums. Another tip, on the guest room floor there 3 elevators on each side, the first on each side have separate buttons from the other 4 and from what we could see the first never worked during our stay, yet no signs of them being out of service, they may have been some kind of special/VIP elevator, but you didn't know that as you stood waiting for the elevator that would never come. My tip ask for a high floor, and don't plan on watching TV, get out check out the city.

Reviews.Title: “Can we move in please?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend recently took me to the St. Regis as a romantic Valentine's Day surprise - although we both frequently stay in excellent hotels for business, we immediately loved the St. Regis! We had a corner suite in the 18th floor with wall to wall views of the city. The plasma TVs were great, as well as the rain showerhead. The luxurious bedding, towels and bath products were all top notch. The gym was also a nice surprise with all the latest TechnoGym equipment. The hotel is within walking distance of Chinatown (for dim sum) and Union Square for shopping. There's also a restaurant downstairs, Ame - which is quite reasonably priced and has homey and innovative Japanese cuisine. We couldn't have asked for a better weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: fhymson
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the St. Regis in San Francisco for 6 days and 5 nights. We had a room with a city view on the 18th floor. Since I was traveling with my wife and my 2 boys, 8 and 11 years old we got a room with 2 queen size beds. The Good: The service was outstanding and everyone tried to do whatever we needed, when asked. The staff was very helpful with directions and one time we needed a nail clipper and we called the butler service and 5 minutes later the clipper arrived with an emory board. We also called down for a DVD and we received "Escape from Alcatraz" in about 5 minutes after we called the butler. The realistic: The rooms are beautiful, the beds are extremely comfortable and everything in the room is controlled electronically, black out curtains, drapes, lights, etc. The decor is contempory with neutral colors. The rooms were average size, although for SF they were probably larger than most. The pool was not yet open, so that was a little disappointing for my kids. Also, I did sense that everytime we walked through the lobby that some of the hotel staff were not that thrilled that we had our kids with us. Location was great. Close to all of the things that we wanted to do in the city. Overall: Outstanding hotel, great service, but probably not the 1st choice for a family. If you are traveling without the kids or on a business trip probably one of the nicest hotels in SF.

HotelInfo.Name: St. Regis Hotel, San Francisco
HotelInfo.Address: 125 3rd St, San Francisco, CA 94103
